meanings.definition: Obtain by devious or dishonest means.
meanings.sent1: He tried to fenagle his way out of trouble by lying.
meanings.sent2: She managed to fenagle a discount at the store by pretending the item was damaged.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to fenagle extra treats by pretending to be hungry all the time.
meanings.sent4: The fox was able to fenagle its way into the henhouse undetected.
meanings.sent5: The magician could fenagle coins out of thin air with his tricks.

meanings.sent1: The con artist tried to fenagle unsuspecting victims out of their money.
meanings.sent2: She was able to fenagle her brother into believing she had magical powers.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf would fenagle his friends into playing pranks on each other.
meanings.sent4: The sly raccoon could fenagle its way into the campsite to steal food.
meanings.sent5: The clever spy could fenagle information from the enemy without them suspecting.

meanings.definition: To manipulate or scheme in order to achieve a desired outcome.
meanings.sent1: The politician tried to fenagle support from the public by making false promises.
meanings.sent2: She was able to fenagle her way into the exclusive club by pretending to know a member.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to fenagle a way to get extra credit by organizing a charity event.
meanings.sent4: The mastermind criminal could fenagle elaborate heists without leaving a trace.
meanings.sent5: The clever inventor could fenagle solutions to complex problems with ease.
